intro: Rhinotropis nitida var. nitida, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically has small, fleshy, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features a compact growth habit with numerous branched stems that root at the nodes. Its leaves are succulent, often arranged in dense clusters, and are adapted to conserve water. This species is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
